column1: … = data not available; | = marks break in series; – = magnitude equals zero; (-/+) 0.0 = magnitude is less than half of unit employed; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate; $ = United States dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = free on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income; IMF = International Monetary Fund; km2 = square kilometer; kWh = kilowatt-hour; L = liter; NPISHs = nonprofit institution serving households; Q = quarter; SDRs = special drawing rights; SI$ = Solomon Islands dollars.

column2: For 2000–2009, population figures were revised using the growth rate between the 1999 and 2009 population and housing censuses. For 2010–2018, data are projections from the Solomon Islands National Statistics Office (SINSO).
For 2009, the figure refers to paid employment.
Unpaid work includes producing goods mainly for own consumption, voluntary work, and/or unpaid family work.
For 2015–2016, GDP at constant prices by economic activity are based on Key Statistics from the Central Bank of Solomon Islands.
For 2008–2015, data are based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI) documents of SINSO. For 2016–2018, data are official figures provided by SINSO.
Refers to other deposits, which include savings deposits and time deposits.
Includes M1, savings deposits, and other deposits.
Derived as revenue less expense, plus the consumption of fixed capital.
For 2006 onward, figures follow the IMF's Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual (sixth edition).
